name: BeerMe
headline: Fun, global Venmo built on USDC
description: BeerMe is a digital wallet for USDC. It’s like Venmo or Cash App, but we use stablecoins to make sending money instant, global, and free. A peer-to-peer electronic cash system is the crypto use-case, but the technology remains inaccessible to mainstream users. Today, after 15 years of innovation, it is finally possible to build a digital wallet that puts crypto into a billion people’s hands, without them even realizing it.
tags: industry:crypto-web3; industry:payments; industry:consumer; industry:messaging; industry:social-media; location:new-york

founders.name: Gray Newfield, Founder
founders.description: Gray Newfield is the co-founder and CEO of BeerMe. He previously worked as a software engineer at Uniswap, the most widely used decentralized exchange on Ethereum. Before that he was a software development engineer at Amazon.com for four years, working on core retail experiences across shopping, promotions, and checkout. Gray holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Yale University.

founders.name: Noah Newfield, Founder
founders.description: Noah is co-founder and COO of BeerMe. He shaped strategy at Uniswap Labs, maker of the largest decentralized exchange on Ethereum, for 2 years and led GTM for the Uniswap wallet. He previously led growth at Genie, the first NFT marketplace aggregator, which did $500M in trading volume, before it was acquired by Uniswap. He studied business at the University of Southern California, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and Universitá Bocconi.

generated_description:
**BeerMe: The Fun, Global Digital Wallet for the Cryptocurrency Era**

Founded in 2024 and hailing from the vibrant tech hub of New York, BeerMe is a fresh entrant into the crypto and payments landscape, backed by the respected Y Combinator Batch F24. This company has its sights set high with a mission that’s simple yet powerful: to make sending money instant, global, and free through the innovative use of stablecoins, specifically USDC.

While many people see cryptocurrency as a complicated realm, BeerMe’s goal is to break down those barriers, making it accessible to everyone—without users even realizing they’re engaging with crypto. Imagine it as a Venmo or Cash App, but with the added benefit of using stablecoins for secure, peer-to-peer transactions. This approach effectively transforms the traditional cash system into something aligned with today’s digital needs, offering faster and inherently global transactions. 

Currently, BeerMe operates with a compact team of just two employees, which speaks to the agility and lean startup ethos they’re embodying. Their Group Partner, Dalton Caldwell, is guiding the ship, likely leveraging his experience to navigate the competitive waters of fintech and crypto.

As for their focus, the company is nestled within several key areas: crypto-web3, payments, consumer interaction, messaging, and social media. This positioning isn’t just strategic; it’s essential to capturing the attention of a digital-savvy audience keen on seamless interactions.

In summary, BeerMe is not just a digital wallet; it's a playful yet serious attempt to democratize the use of cryptocurrency for everyday transactions. With their innovative approach and robust backing, they’re well on their way to putting crypto into the hands of a billion people, making personal finance as simple as sending a text or sharing a beer.

For more information, you can check them out at [beerme.world](https://beerme.world/).
